io.trane.future

Class Promise<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.trane.future.Promise<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the asynchronous computation result
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Future<T>, InterruptHandler

    public abstract class Promise<T>
extends Object
implements Future<T>

    Promise is a Future that provides methods to set its result. They are useful to interact with callback-based APIs like the ones that are typically provided by network libraries. A promise can be created and returned synchronously to the caller, but its completion is deferred until the value is set, typically by a callback.

        Returns:
        the new promise instance.

      • apply

        Returns:
        the new promise instance.

      • apply

        public static final <T> Promise<T> apply()

        Creates a promise without an interrupt handler. Interrupt signals are ignored by the created promise since there’s no handler.

        Returns:
        the new promise instance.

      • create

        public static final <T> Promise<T> create(java.util.function.Function<Promise<T>,InterruptHandler> handlerBuilder)

        Creates a new promise using a handler builder that it’s based on the promise under creation. This method allows the user to define handlers that use the it’s own promise.

        Parameters:
        handlerBuilder - a builder that receives the new promise and returns the interrupt handler of the new promise.
        Returns:
        the new promise.

      • become

        public final void become(Future<T> result)

        Becomes another future. This and result become the same: both are completed with the same result and both receive the same interrupt signals.

        Parameters:
        result - the future to become.

      • becomeIfEmpty

        public final boolean becomeIfEmpty(Future<T> result)

        Becomes another future only if this promise is undefined. This and result become the same: both are completed with the same result and both receive the same interrupt signals.

        Parameters:
        result - the future to become.
        Returns:
        if the operation was successful

      • get

        public final T get(long timeout,
                   TimeUnit unit)
            throws CheckedFutureException
        Description copied from interface: Future

        Blocks the current thread until this future is satisfied and gets its result. This method normally only useful for tests, avoid it for production code.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        timeout - for how long the thread should wait for the result
        unit - time unit of the timeout
        Returns:
        the result if the future completes successfully or an exception if the future completes with an exception.
        Throws:
        CheckedFutureException - wrapper exception used when the result is a checked exception. If the exception is unchecked, it’s thrown without this wrapper.

      • join

        public final void join(long timeout,
                       TimeUnit unit)
                throws CheckedFutureException
        Description copied from interface: Future

        Blocks the current thread until this future is satisfied. This method normally only useful for tests, avoid it for production code.

        This method is similar to get but it doesn’t return the future value nor throws if the future completes with an exception.

        Specified by:
        join in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        timeout - for how long the thread should wait for the result
        unit - time unit of the timeout
        Throws:
        CheckedFutureException - wrapper exception used when the result is a checked exception. If the exception is unchecked, it’s thrown without this wrapper.

        Returns:

        public final Future<T> respond(Responder<? super T> r)
        Description copied from interface: Future

      • rescue

        public final Future<T> rescue(java.util.function.Function<Throwable,? extends Future<T>> f)
        Description copied from interface: Future

        If this future completes with an exception, applies the provided rescue function and flattens the result.

        Note that it’s possible to return a Future.exception from f if the exception can’t be recovered.

        Specified by:
        rescue in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be executed.
        Returns:
        a future with the result of f.

      • delayed

        public final Future<T> delayed(long delay,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit,
                               ScheduledExecutorService scheduler)
        Description copied from interface: Future

        Delays the result of this future. It method doesn’t take in consideration how long this future takes to be completed. It assumes the state of this future after delay, being it completed or not.

        Specified by:
        delayed in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        delay - for how long the future must be delayed
        timeUnit - the time unit for delay
        scheduler - used to schedule an internal task to be executed after delay.
        Returns:
        a future that assumes the state of this future after delay.

      • proxyTo

        public final void proxyTo(Promise<T> p)
        Description copied from interface: Future

        Proxies the result of this future, successful or not, to a Promise.

        Specified by:
        proxyTo in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        p - the Promise to be updated once this future completes.

      • within

        public final Future<T> within(long timeout,
                              TimeUnit timeUnit,
                              ScheduledExecutorService scheduler,
                              Throwable exception)
        Description copied from interface: Future

        Creates a future that fails with a exception if this future isn’t completed within the timeout.

        Specified by:
        within in interface Future<T>
        Parameters:
        timeout - how long to wait for the result
        timeUnit - the time unit of timeout.
        scheduler - used to schedule an internal task after the timeout.
        exception - the exception to be thrown when the future times out.
        Returns:
        a future that completes with the result of this future within the timeout, a failed future otherwise.
